description: Foundational high school biology course introducing scientific inquiry, cell structure and processes, genetics, evolution by natural selection, ecology, plant biology, and human body systems. Designed to build conceptual understanding, scientific literacy, and readiness for higher-level biology.

topics.name: Unit 1: Nature of Biology & Scientific Inquiry
topics.description: Branches of biology, characteristics of living things, scientific method, hypothesis formation, experimental design, variables and controls, data collection, graphing, measurement, lab safety, and ethical practices in science

topics.name: Unit 2: Cell Theory & Structure
topics.description: History of cell theory, microscopy, prokaryotic vs eukaryotic cells, organelles and their functions (nucleus, mitochondria, chloroplasts, ER, Golgi, lysosomes), cytoplasm, cytoskeleton, and levels of biological organization

topics.name: Unit 3: Cell Membrane & Transport
topics.description: Cell membrane structure (phospholipid bilayer, proteins, carbohydrates), selective permeability, diffusion, osmosis, facilitated transport, active transport, endocytosis, exocytosis, tonicity (hypotonic, isotonic, hypertonic), and homeostasis

topics.name: Unit 4: Cell Division & Reproduction
topics.description: Cell cycle, mitosis phases, cytokinesis, purposes of cell division, asexual vs sexual reproduction, introduction to meiosis, chromosome number, gametes, fertilization, and basic reproductive strategies

topics.name: Unit 5: Introduction to Genetics
topics.description: DNA structure basics, genes and chromosomes, Mendelâ€™s experiments, traits, alleles, dominant vs recessive, Punnett squares, monohybrid crosses, phenotype vs genotype, simple inheritance patterns, and probability

topics.name: Unit 6: Variation & Natural Selection
topics.description: Types of variation (genetic, environmental), adaptation, survival and reproduction, natural selection mechanisms, evidence of evolution, selective pressures, and introduction to speciation

topics.name: Unit 7: Ecology & Ecosystems
topics.description: Ecological organization (organism to biosphere), habitats, niches, food chains and food webs, energy flow, trophic levels, biomes, population dynamics, symbiotic relationships, human impact, and sustainability

topics.name: Unit 8: Plant Biology
topics.description: Plant cell structure, photosynthesis basics, plant tissues, roots, stems, leaves, plant reproduction, pollination, seed formation, growth, and tropisms (phototropism, gravitropism, thigmotropism)

topics.name: Unit 9: Human Biology & Health
topics.description: Overview of human body systems (digestive, respiratory, circulatory, excretory, nervous, endocrine, immune, skeletal, muscular), homeostasis, nutrition, disease, pathogens, immune response, and lifestyle factors affecting health
